channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Federal judge strikes down Trump's order suspending asylum access at the southern border
item.description: The ruling was a win for immigrant advocacy groups that sued over the president's order, which they say put thousands of lives at risk.
item.content:encoded:
The ruling was a win for immigrant advocacy groups that sued over the president's order, which they say put thousands of lives at risk.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: After decades on NPR, this familiar voice is retiring
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro and longtime newscaster Jack Speer chat about his early years covering business for the network, his retirement, and what he'll miss about covering the daily news.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ari Shapiro and longtime newscaster Jack Speer chat about his early years covering business for the network, his retirement, and what he'll miss about covering the daily news.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug

item.title: A Ukrainian actress saw herself in a White House video -- and created one in response
item.description: Antonina Khyzhniak, who appeared in stock footage included in a White House Instagram video for the Trump administration's tax bill, responded with a humorous video — and a serious message.
item.content:encoded:
Antonina Khyzhniak, who appeared in stock footage included in a White House Instagram video for the Trump administration's tax bill, responded with a humorous video — and a serious message.

(Image credit: Screenshot by NPR)
item.dc:creator: Polina Lytvynova

item.title: A Dangerous Quest for Food in Gaza
item.description: An NPR journalist in Gaza describes his harrowing experience seeking food from a distribution site run by private American contractors. He found himself facing Israeli military fire, crowds fighting for rations, and masked thieves.
item.content:encoded:
An NPR journalist in Gaza describes his harrowing experience seeking food from a distribution site run by private American contractors. He found himself facing Israeli military fire, crowds fighting for rations, and masked thieves.

(Image credit: Anas Baba)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: CBS is the latest news giant to bend to Trump's power
item.description: With a $16 million payment to settle President Trump's lawsuit over 60 Minutes' interview with Kamala Harris, CBS becomes the latest media outlet to bow to his power.
item.content:encoded:
60 Minutes interview with former Vice President Kamala Harris during last fall's elections.'/>

With a $16 million payment to settle President Trump's lawsuit over 60 Minutes' interview with Kamala Harris, CBS becomes the latest media outlet to bow to his power.

(Image credit: Beata Zawrzel/NurPhoto via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: The GOP's massive bill would add trillions of dollars to the country's debt
item.description: The GOP tax cut and spending bill passed by the Senate this week is expected to add trillions of dollars to the federal debt over the next decade. The savings would mostly go to top earners.
item.content:encoded:
The GOP tax cut and spending bill passed by the Senate this week is expected to add trillions of dollars to the federal debt over the next decade. The savings would mostly go to top earners.

(Image credit: Derek White)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Trump announces trade deal with Vietnam
item.description: The announcement came after President Trump in April proposed a steep 46% tariff on Vietnamese imports; he later paused those tariffs while talks continued.
item.content:encoded:
The announcement came after President Trump in April proposed a steep 46% tariff on Vietnamese imports; he later paused those tariffs while talks continued.

(Image credit: Luong Thai Linh)
item.dc:creator: Nga Pham

item.title: Whether you're driving or flying, here are travel tips for the Fourth of July weekend
item.description: AAA anticipates that a record 72.2 million people will travel this holiday weekend. Here's how to prepare if you're one of them.
item.content:encoded:
AAA anticipates that a record 72.2 million people will travel this holiday weekend. Here's how to prepare if you're one of them.

(Image credit: David Paul Morris)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: How Trump's immigration crackdown is sweeping up longtime residents and workers
item.description: Jacob Soboroff of NBC News says the Trump administration promised to deport the "worst of the worst" criminal immigrants, but is now detaining undocumented workers with no serious criminal record.
item.content:encoded: Jacob Soboroff of NBC News says the Trump administration promised to deport the "worst of the worst" criminal immigrants, but is now detaining undocumented workers with no serious criminal record.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Sean Combs found guilty on two counts, but acquitted on most serious charges
item.description: The music mogul was found guilty of transportation to engage in prostitution, but the jury found him not guilty on three counts related to racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking.
item.content:encoded:
The music mogul was found guilty of transportation to engage in prostitution, but the jury found him not guilty on three counts related to racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking.

(Image credit: Jane Rosenberg)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas
